quotes.quote: It is the tragedy of the world that no one knows what he doesn't know and the less a man knows, the more sure he is that he knows everything.
When you close your eyes to tragedy, you close your eyes to greatness.
The tragedy of this world is that everyone is alone. For a life in the past cannot be shared with the present.
In this world there are two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. The last is much the worst.
Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.

A tragedy is the imitation of an action that is serious and also, as having magnitude, complete in itself with incidents arousing pity and fear, wherewith to accomplish its catharsis of such emotions.

Here is the tragedy: when you are the victim of depression, not only do you feel utterly helpless and abandoned by the world, you also know that very few people can understand, or even begin to believe, that life can be this painful.
The tragedy about history - personally and globally is that while we may learn it we rarely learn from it.
Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
You use everything. You use tragedy you use everything.
There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
Life's tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.
Tragedy is like strong acid it dissolves away all but the very gold of truth.
The greatest tragedy in mankind's entire history may be the hijacking of morality by religion.
One of the greatest tragedies in life is to lose your own sense of self and accept the version of you that is expected by everyone else.

The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or of joy. The tragedy of this world is that everyone is alone. For a life in the past cannot be shared with the present. Each person who gets stuck in time gets stuck alone.
Tragedy, for me, is not a conflict between right and wrong, but between two different kinds of right.
The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or joy.
There is nothing more tragic than to find an individual bogged down in the length of life, devoid of breadth.
It's not the tragedies that kill us, it's the messes.
Tragedy is a representation of action that is worthy of serious attention, complete in itself and of some magnitude bringing about by means of pity and fear the purging of such emotions.
This world is a comedy to those that think, a tragedy to those that feel.
A great tragedy is occurring. Millions of people are dying prematurely. These people are killing themselves and they don't even know it.
Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
The tragedy is not that love doesn't last. The tragedy is the love that lasts.
You get tragedy where the tree, instead of bending, breaks.
A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
Tragedy makes you grow up.
